FIGURES 1‚Äì4. Exuvium of mature larva of

‚Äì2, dorsal view; 3, latero‚Äìventral view; 4, ventral view.

FIGURES 5‚Äì15. Mature larva of
A. latefasciatus Reitter, 1892: 5
, antenna (dorso‚Äìlateral); 6, head (apex) of hastiseta; 7, frons (dorsal); 8, mandible (dorsal); 9, mandible (latero‚Äìventral); 10, epipharynx (ventral); 11, epipharynx (dorsal); 12, maxilla (ventral); 13, apex of lacinia (ventral); 14, apex of lacinia (dorsal); 15, labium with labial palpi (ventral). Scale bar = 0.1 mm.

FIGURES 16‚Äì21. Mature larva of
A. latefasciatus Reitter, 1892: 16
, pronotum (dorsal, right half); 17, right proleg (dorsal); 18, abdominal tergum I (dorsal, right half); 19, abdominal tergum VII (dorsal, right half); 20, abdominal tergum VIII (dorsal, right half); 21, abdominal tergum IX (dorsal, left part). Scale bar = 0.1 mm. In Figs 16, 18‚Äì20 large circles with ring inside represent points of insertion of spicisetae, small circles represent points of insertion of hastisetae, dots represents of black pigmented areas.
